Analysis of existing information
This is very useful when evaluating effectiveness and
efficiency.
Example:
The percentage of women attending antenatal care
and the number of iron tablets dispensed are part
of routine records and reports.
Evaluating the effects of interventions 59
Important points to consider
Every evaluation activity should be planned.  The following
should be determined:
• what is to be evaluated;
• how the evaluation will be
